review.title: The Shape of a Benedictine Monastery: The SaintGall Ontology
review.abstract: We present an OWL 2 ontology representing the Saint Gall plan, one of the most ancient documents arrived intact to us, that describes the ideal model of a Benedictine monastic complex, and that inspired the design of many European monasteries.

sections.heading: 3. Conclusions
sections.text: We presented an ontology for the Saint Gall Plan, which describes the ideal model of the structure of a monastic Benedictine building, allowing us to study the main features of European monastic buildings such as the Monastery of San Nicolò l'Arena in Catania, the Abbey of Santa Giustina in Padua, the Abbey of Cluny, the Abbey of Montecassino [8]. By means of Saint Gall Ontology, scholars and researchers in the humanities can effectively compare several different monastic architectures and similarities, which they compare not only in architectural and stylistic outpatient clinics, but also in interpretative and theological ontologies.
